     504             :                                             // character just beyond the maximum

     511             :                                             }

     603             : //----------------------------------------------------------------------
     604             : // FeatureGenerateInsertSQL()
     605             : //
     606             : // Build a SQL INSERT statement that references all the columns in

    1974             : /************************************************************************/

    2285             : /************************************************************************/
    2286             : /*                           ICreateFeature()                           */
    2287             : /************************************************************************/
    2288             : 
    2289             : // rtreeValueDown() / rtreeValueUp() come from SQLite3 source code
    2290             : // SQLite3 RTree stores min/max values as float. So do the same for our
    2291             : // GPKGRTreeEntry
    2292             : 
    2293             : /*
    2294             : ** Rounding constants for float->double conversion.
    2295             : */
    2296             : #define RNDTOWARDS (1.0 - 1.0 / 8388608.0) /* Round towards zero */
    2297             : #define RNDAWAY (1.0 + 1.0 / 8388608.0)    /* Round away from zero */
    2298             : 
    2299             : /*
    2300             : ** Convert an sqlite3_value into an RtreeValue (presumably a float)
    2301             : ** while taking care to round toward negative or positive, respectively.
    2302             : */
    2303      493884 : static float rtreeValueDown(double d)
    2304             : {
    2305      493884 :     float f = static_cast<float>(d);
    2306      493884 :     if (f > d)
    2307             :     {
    2308       13014 :         f = static_cast<float>(d * (d < 0 ? RNDAWAY : RNDTOWARDS));
    2309             :     }
    2310      493884 :     return f;
    2311             : }
    2312             : 
    2313      493884 : static float rtreeValueUp(double d)
    2314             : {
    2315      493884 :     float f = static_cast<float>(d);
    2316      493884 :     if (f < d)
    2317             :     {
    2318       13117 :         f = static_cast<float>(d * (d < 0 ? RNDTOWARDS : RNDAWAY));
    2319             :     }
    2320      493884 :     return f;
    2321             : }

    2719             : 
    2720             : /************************************************************************/
    2721             : /*                          StartAsyncRTree()                           */
    2722             : /************************************************************************/
    2723             : 
    2724             : // We create a temporary database with only the RTree, and we insert
    2725             : // records into it in a dedicated thread, in parallel of the main thread
    2726             : // that inserts rows in the user table. When the layer is finalized, we
    2727             : // just use bulk copy statements of the form
    2728             : // INSERT INTO rtree_xxxx_rowid/node/parent SELECT * FROM
    2729             : // temp_rtree.my_rtree_rowid/node/parent to copy the RTree auxiliary tables into
    2730             : // the main database, which is a very fast operation.
    2731             : 
    2732          48 : void OGRGeoPackageTableLayer::StartAsyncRTree()
    2733             : {
    2734          48 :     m_osAsyncDBName = m_poDS->GetDescription();
    2735          48 :     m_osAsyncDBName += ".tmp_rtree_";
    2736          48 :     bool bCanUseTableName = false;
    2737          48 :     if (strlen(m_pszTableName) <= 32)
    2738             :     {
    2739          36 :         bCanUseTableName = true;
    2740          36 :         constexpr char DIGIT_ZERO = '0';
    2741         144 :         for (int i = 0; m_pszTableName[i] != '\0'; ++i)
    2742             :         {
    2743         120 :             const char ch = m_pszTableName[i];
    2744         132 :             if (!((ch >= 'a' && ch <= 'z') || (ch >= 'A' && ch <= 'Z') ||
    2745          12 :                   (ch >= DIGIT_ZERO && ch <= '9') || ch == '.' || ch == '_'))
    2746             :             {
    2747          12 :                 bCanUseTableName = false;
    2748          12 :                 break;
    2749             :             }
    2750             :         }
    2751             :     }
    2752          48 :     if (bCanUseTableName)
    2753          24 :         m_osAsyncDBName += m_pszTableName;
    2754             :     else
    2755             :     {
    2756          24 :         m_osAsyncDBName += CPLMD5String(m_pszTableName);
    2757             :     }
    2758          48 :     m_osAsyncDBName += ".db";
    2759             : 
    2760          48 :     m_osAsyncDBAttachName = "temp_rtree_";
    2761          48 :     m_osAsyncDBAttachName += CPLMD5String(m_pszTableName);
    2762             : 
    2763          48 :     VSIUnlink(m_osAsyncDBName.c_str());
    2764          48 :     CPLDebug("GPKG", "Creating background RTree DB %s",
    2765             :              m_osAsyncDBName.c_str());

    2769             :         SQLITE_OK)

    2771           0 :         CPLError(CE_Failure, CPLE_AppDefined, "sqlite3_open_v2() of %s failed",
    2772             :                  m_osAsyncDBName.c_str());
    2773           0 :         sqlite3_close(m_hAsyncDBHandle);
    2774           0 :         m_hAsyncDBHandle = nullptr;
    2775             :     }
    2776          48 :     if (m_hAsyncDBHandle != nullptr)
    2777             :     {
    2778             :         /* Make sure our auxiliary DB has the same page size as the main one.
    2779             :          * Because the number of RTree cells depends on the SQLite page size.
    2780             :          * However the sqlite implementation limits to 51 cells maximum per page,
    2781             :          * which is reached starting with a page size of 2048 bytes.
    2782             :          * As the default SQLite page size is 4096 currently, having potentially
    2783             :          * different page sizes >= 4096 between the main and auxiliary DBs would
    2784             :          * not be a practical issue, but better be consistent.
    2785             :          */
    2786             :         const int nPageSize =

    2788             :

    2792             :                                   "PRAGMA synchronous = OFF;",

    2794             :         {
    2795          48 :             char *pszSQL = sqlite3_mprintf("ATTACH DATABASE '%q' AS '%q'",

    2797             :                                            m_osAsyncDBAttachName.c_str());

    2862             : {
    2863          36 :     CPLDebug("GPKG", "Cancel background RTree creation");
    2864          36 :     m_oQueueRTreeEntries.push({});
    2865          36 :     m_oThreadRTree.join();
    2866          36 :     m_bThreadRTreeStarted = false;
    2867          36 :     if (m_hAsyncDBHandle)
    2868             :     {

    2870          36 :         m_hAsyncDBHandle = nullptr;

    2937             : /************************************************************************/
    2938             : /*                   GetMaxRAMUsageAllowedForRTree()                    */
    2939             : /************************************************************************/
    2940             : 
    2941         836 : static size_t GetMaxRAMUsageAllowedForRTree()

    3242             : 
    3243             : //----------------------------------------------------------------------
    3244             : // FeatureGenerateUpdateSQL()
    3245             : //
    3246             : // Build a SQL UPDATE statement that references all the columns in
    3247             : // the OGRFeatureDefn that the user asked to be updated, then prepare it for
    3248             : // repeated use in a prepared statement. All statements start off with geometry
    3249             : // (if it exists, and if it is asked to be updated), then reference each column
    3250             : // in the order it appears in the OGRFeatureDefn.
    3251             : // FeatureBindParameters operates on the expectation of this
    3252             : // column ordering.
    3253             : 
    3254             : //
    3255          11 : std::string OGRGeoPackageTableLayer::FeatureGenerateUpdateSQL(
    3256             :     const OGRFeature *poFeature, int nUpdatedFieldsCount,
    3257             :     const int *panUpdatedFieldsIdx, int nUpdatedGeomFieldsCount,
    3258             :     const int * /*panUpdatedGeomFieldsIdx*/) const
    3259             : {
    3260          11 :     bool bNeedComma = false;
    3261          11 :     const OGRFeatureDefn *poFeatureDefn = poFeature->GetDefnRef();
    3262             : 
    3263             :     /* Set up our SQL string basics */
    3264          22 :     std::string osUpdate("UPDATE \"");
    3265          11 :     osUpdate += SQLEscapeName(m_pszTableName);
    3266          11 :     osUpdate += "\" SET ";
    3267             :

    3269             :     {

    3272           2 :             SQLEscapeName(poFeatureDefn->GetGeomFieldDefn(0)->GetNameRef());

    3274           2 :         bNeedComma = true;

    3950           0 :             break;
    3951             :         }

    4209             : /************************************************************************/
    4210             : /*                         GetExtentFromRTree()                         */
    4211             : /************************************************************************/
    4212             : 
    4213         115 : static bool GetExtentFromRTree(sqlite3 *hDB, const std::string &osRTreeName,
    4214             :                                double &minx, double &miny, double &maxx,
    4215             :                                double &maxy)
    4216             : {
    4217             :     // Cf https://github.com/sqlite/sqlite/blob/master/ext/rtree/rtree.c
    4218             :     // for the description of the content of the rtree _node table
    4219             :     // We fetch the root node (nodeno = 1) and iterates over its cells, to
    4220             :     // take the min/max of their minx/maxx/miny/maxy values.
    4221         115 :     char *pszSQL = sqlite3_mprintf(
    4222             :         "SELECT data FROM \"%w_node\" WHERE nodeno = 1", osRTreeName.c_str());
    4223         115 :     sqlite3_stmt *hStmt = nullptr;
    4224         115 :     CPL_IGNORE_RET_VAL(sqlite3_prepare_v2(hDB, pszSQL, -1, &hStmt, nullptr));
    4225         115 :     sqlite3_free(pszSQL);
    4226         115 :     bool bOK = false;
    4227         115 :     if (hStmt)
    4228             :     {
    4229         230 :         if (sqlite3_step(hStmt) == SQLITE_ROW &&
    4230         115 :             sqlite3_column_type(hStmt, 0) == SQLITE_BLOB)
    4231             :         {
    4232         115 :             const int nBytes = sqlite3_column_bytes(hStmt, 0);
    4233             :             // coverity[tainted_data_return]
    4234             :             const GByte *pabyData =
    4235         115 :                 static_cast<const GByte *>(sqlite3_column_blob(hStmt, 0));
    4236         115 :             constexpr int BLOB_HEADER_SIZE = 4;
    4237         115 :             if (nBytes > BLOB_HEADER_SIZE)
    4238             :             {
    4239         115 :                 const int nCellCount = (pabyData[2] << 8) | pabyData[3];
    4240         115 :                 constexpr int SIZEOF_CELL = 24;  // int64_t + 4 float
    4241         115 :                 if (nCellCount >= 1 &&
    4242         108 :                     nBytes >= BLOB_HEADER_SIZE + SIZEOF_CELL * nCellCount)
    4243             :                 {
    4244         108 :                     minx = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
    4245         108 :                     miny = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
    4246         108 :                     maxx = -std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
    4247         108 :                     maxy = -std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
    4248         108 :                     size_t offset = BLOB_HEADER_SIZE;
    4249         406 :                     for (int i = 0; i < nCellCount; ++i)
    4250             :                     {
    4251         298 :                         offset += sizeof(int64_t);
    4252             : 
    4253             :                         float fMinX;
    4254         298 :                         memcpy(&fMinX, pabyData + offset, sizeof(float));
    4255         298 :                         offset += sizeof(float);
    4256         298 :                         CPL_MSBPTR32(&fMinX);
    4257         298 :                         minx = std::min(minx, static_cast<double>(fMinX));
    4258             : 
    4259             :                         float fMaxX;
    4260         298 :                         memcpy(&fMaxX, pabyData + offset, sizeof(float));
    4261         298 :                         offset += sizeof(float);
    4262         298 :                         CPL_MSBPTR32(&fMaxX);
    4263         298 :                         maxx = std::max(maxx, static_cast<double>(fMaxX));
    4264             : 
    4265             :                         float fMinY;
    4266         298 :                         memcpy(&fMinY, pabyData + offset, sizeof(float));
    4267         298 :                         offset += sizeof(float);
    4268         298 :                         CPL_MSBPTR32(&fMinY);
    4269         298 :                         miny = std::min(miny, static_cast<double>(fMinY));
    4270             : 
    4271             :                         float fMaxY;
    4272         298 :                         memcpy(&fMaxY, pabyData + offset, sizeof(float));
    4273         298 :                         offset += sizeof(float);
    4274         298 :                         CPL_MSBPTR32(&fMaxY);
    4275         298 :                         maxy = std::max(maxy, static_cast<double>(fMaxY));
    4276             :                     }
    4277             : 
    4278         108 :                     bOK = true;
    4279             :                 }
    4280             :             }
    4281             :         }
    4282         115 :         sqlite3_finalize(hStmt);
    4283             :     }
    4284         115 :     return bOK;
    4285             : }
    4286             :

    4399             : /************************************************************************/
    4400             : /*                           TestCapability()                           */
    4401             : /************************************************************************/
    4402             : 
    4403        1844 : int OGRGeoPackageTableLayer::TestCapability(const char *pszCap) const
    4404             : {
    4405        1844 :     if (!m_bFeatureDefnCompleted)
    4406          14 :         GetLayerDefn();
    4407        1844 :     if (EQUAL(pszCap, OLCSequentialWrite))
    4408             :     {
    4409          31 :         return m_poDS->GetUpdate();
    4410             :     }
    4411        1813 :     else if (EQUAL(pszCap, OLCCreateField) || EQUAL(pszCap, OLCDeleteField) ||

    4680             : /************************************************************************/
    4681             : /*                   WorkaroundUpdate1TriggerIssue()                    */
    4682             : /************************************************************************/
    4683             : 
    4684          18 : void OGRGeoPackageTableLayer::WorkaroundUpdate1TriggerIssue()
    4685             : {
    4686             :     // Workaround issue of https://sqlite.org/forum/forumpost/8c8de6ff91
    4687             :     // Basically the official _update1 spatial index trigger doesn't work
    4688             :     // with current versions of SQLite when invoked from an UPSERT statement.
    4689             :     // In GeoPackage 1.4, the update6 and update7 triggers replace update1
    4690             : 
    4691          18 :     if (m_bHasUpdate6And7Triggers || m_poFeatureDefn->GetGeomFieldCount() == 0)
    4692          12 :         return;
    4693             : 
    4694          11 :     const char *pszT = m_pszTableName;
    4695          11 :     const char *pszC = m_poFeatureDefn->GetGeomFieldDefn(0)->GetNameRef();
    4696          11 :     const char *pszI = GetFIDColumn();
    4697             : 
    4698          11 :     CPLString osRTreeName = "rtree_";
    4699          11 :     osRTreeName += pszT;
    4700          11 :     osRTreeName += "_";
    4701          11 :     osRTreeName += pszC;
    4702             : 
    4703             :     // Check if update6 and update7 triggers are there
    4704             :     {
    4705          22 :         char *pszSQL = sqlite3_mprintf(
    4706             :             "SELECT * FROM sqlite_master WHERE type = 'trigger' "
    4707             :             "AND name IN ('%q', '%q')",
    4708          22 :             (m_osRTreeName + "_update6").c_str(),
    4709          22 :             (m_osRTreeName + "_update7").c_str());
    4710          11 :         auto oResult = SQLQuery(m_poDS->GetDB(), pszSQL);
    4711          11 :         sqlite3_free(pszSQL);
    4712          11 :         if (oResult && oResult->RowCount() == 2)
    4713             :         {
    4714           5 :             m_bHasUpdate6And7Triggers = true;
    4715           5 :             return;
    4716             :         }
    4717             :     }
    4718             : 
    4719             :     char *pszSQL =
    4720           6 :         sqlite3_mprintf("SELECT sql FROM sqlite_master WHERE type = 'trigger' "
    4721             :                         "AND name = '%q'",
    4722          12 :                         (m_osRTreeName + "_update1").c_str());
    4723           6 :     auto oResult = SQLQuery(m_poDS->GetDB(), pszSQL);
    4724           6 :     sqlite3_free(pszSQL);
    4725           6 :     if (oResult && oResult->RowCount() == 1)
    4726             :     {
    4727           6 :         const char *pszTriggerSQL = oResult->GetValue(0, 0);
    4728           6 :         if (pszTriggerSQL)
    4729             :         {
    4730           6 :             m_osUpdate1Trigger = pszTriggerSQL;
    4731             :         }
    4732             :     }
    4733           6 :     if (m_osUpdate1Trigger.empty())
    4734           0 :         return;
    4735             : 
    4736           6 :     m_bUpdate1TriggerDisabled = true;
    4737             : 
    4738             :     pszSQL =
    4739           6 :         sqlite3_mprintf("DROP TRIGGER \"%w_update1\"", osRTreeName.c_str());
    4740           6 :     SQLCommand(m_poDS->GetDB(), pszSQL);
    4741           6 :     sqlite3_free(pszSQL);
    4742             : 
    4743           6 :     pszSQL = sqlite3_mprintf(
    4744             :         "CREATE TRIGGER \"%w_update6\" AFTER UPDATE OF \"%w\" "
    4745             :         "ON \"%w\" "
    4746             :         "WHEN OLD.\"%w\" = NEW.\"%w\" AND "
    4747             :         "(NEW.\"%w\" NOTNULL AND NOT ST_IsEmpty(NEW.\"%w\")) AND "
    4748             :         "(OLD.\"%w\" NOTNULL AND NOT ST_IsEmpty(OLD.\"%w\")) "
    4749             :         "BEGIN "
    4750             :         "UPDATE \"%w\" SET "
    4751             :         "minx = ST_MinX(NEW.\"%w\"), maxx = ST_MaxX(NEW.\"%w\"),"
    4752             :         "miny = ST_MinY(NEW.\"%w\"), maxy = ST_MaxY(NEW.\"%w\") "
    4753             :         "WHERE id = NEW.\"%w\";"
    4754             :         "END",
    4755             :         osRTreeName.c_str(), pszC, pszT, pszI, pszI, pszC, pszC, pszC, pszC,

    4758           6 :     sqlite3_free(pszSQL);
    4759             : 
    4760           6 :     pszSQL = sqlite3_mprintf(
    4761             :         "CREATE TRIGGER \"%w_update7\" AFTER UPDATE OF \"%w\" ON "

    4814             : /************************************************************************/
    4815             : /*                ReturnSQLCreateSpatialIndexTriggers()                 */
    4816             : /************************************************************************/
    4817             : 
    4818         808 : CPLString OGRGeoPackageTableLayer::ReturnSQLCreateSpatialIndexTriggers(
    4819             :     const char *pszTableName, const char *pszGeomColName)
    4820             : {
    4821             :     char *pszSQL;
    4822         808 :     CPLString osSQL;
    4823             : 
    4824         808 :     const char *pszT = (pszTableName) ? pszTableName : m_pszTableName;
    4825             :     const char *pszC = (pszGeomColName)
    4826         808 :                            ? pszGeomColName
    4827         804 :                            : m_poFeatureDefn->GetGeomFieldDefn(0)->GetNameRef();
    4828         808 :     const char *pszI = GetFIDColumn();
    4829             : 
    4830        1616 :     CPLString osRTreeName = "rtree_";
    4831         808 :     osRTreeName += pszT;
    4832         808 :     osRTreeName += "_";
    4833         808 :     osRTreeName += pszC;
    4834             : 
    4835             :     /* Conditions: Insertion of non-empty geometry
    4836             :        Actions   : Insert record into rtree */
    4837         808 :     pszSQL = sqlite3_mprintf(
    4838             :         "CREATE TRIGGER \"%w_insert\" AFTER INSERT ON \"%w\" "
    4839             :         "WHEN (new.\"%w\" NOT NULL AND NOT ST_IsEmpty(NEW.\"%w\")) "
    4840             :         "BEGIN "
    4841             :         "INSERT OR REPLACE INTO \"%w\" VALUES ("
    4842             :         "NEW.\"%w\","
    4843             :         "ST_MinX(NEW.\"%w\"), ST_MaxX(NEW.\"%w\"),"
    4844             :         "ST_MinY(NEW.\"%w\"), ST_MaxY(NEW.\"%w\")"
    4845             :         "); "
    4846             :         "END",
    4847             :         osRTreeName.c_str(), pszT, pszC, pszC, osRTreeName.c_str(), pszI, pszC,

    4849         808 :     osSQL += pszSQL;
    4850         808 :     sqlite3_free(pszSQL);
    4851             :

    4854             :     {
    4855             :         /* Conditions: Update a non-empty geometry with another non-empty geometry
    4856             :            Actions   : Replace record from R-tree
    4857             :         */
    4858         796 :         pszSQL = sqlite3_mprintf(
    4859             :             "CREATE TRIGGER \"%w_update6\" AFTER UPDATE OF \"%w\" "
    4860             :             "ON \"%w\" "
    4861             :             "WHEN OLD.\"%w\" = NEW.\"%w\" AND "
    4862             :             "(NEW.\"%w\" NOTNULL AND NOT ST_IsEmpty(NEW.\"%w\")) AND "

    4867             :             "miny = ST_MinY(NEW.\"%w\"), maxy = ST_MaxY(NEW.\"%w\") "
    4868             :             "WHERE id = NEW.\"%w\";"
    4869             :             "END",

    5294             : /************************************************************************/
    5295             : /*                 ReturnSQLDropSpatialIndexTriggers()                  */
    5296             : /************************************************************************/
    5297             : 
    5298          62 : CPLString OGRGeoPackageTableLayer::ReturnSQLDropSpatialIndexTriggers()
    5299             : {
    5300          62 :     char *pszSQL = sqlite3_mprintf(
    5301             :         "DROP TRIGGER \"%w_insert\";"
    5302             :         "DROP TRIGGER IF EXISTS \"%w_update1\";"  // replaced by update6 and update7 in GPKG 1.4
    5303             :         "DROP TRIGGER \"%w_update2\";"
    5304             :         "DROP TRIGGER IF EXISTS \"%w_update3\";"  // replace by update5 in GPKG 1.4
    5305             :         "DROP TRIGGER \"%w_update4\";"
    5306             :         "DROP TRIGGER IF EXISTS \"%w_update5\";"  // replace update3 in GPKG 1.4
    5307             :         "DROP TRIGGER IF EXISTS \"%w_update6\";"  // replace update1 in GPKG 1.4
    5308             :         "DROP TRIGGER IF EXISTS \"%w_update7\";"  // replace update1 in GPKG 1.4
    5309             :         "DROP TRIGGER \"%w_delete\";",
    5310             :         m_osRTreeName.c_str(), m_osRTreeName.c_str(), m_osRTreeName.c_str(),

    7474             :             // 4th byte is 0 and use that to decide how to replace the old SRID

    7649        1376 : static void OGR_GPKG_GeometryTypeAggregate_Step(sqlite3_context *pContext,
    7650             :                                                 int /*argc*/,
    7651             :                                                 sqlite3_value **argv)
    7652             : {
    7653             :     const GByte *pabyBLOB =
    7654        1376 :         reinterpret_cast<const GByte *>(sqlite3_value_blob(argv[0]));
    7655             : 
    7656             :     auto poContext = static_cast<GeometryTypeAggregateContext *>(
    7657        1376 :         sqlite3_user_data(pContext));
    7658             : 
    7659        1376 :     OGRwkbGeometryType eGeometryType = wkbNone;
    7660        1376 :     OGRErr err = OGRERR_FAILURE;
    7661        1376 :     if (pabyBLOB != nullptr)
    7662             :     {
    7663             :         GPkgHeader sHeader;
    7664        1353 :         const int nBLOBLen = sqlite3_value_bytes(argv[0]);
    7665        2706 :         if (GPkgHeaderFromWKB(pabyBLOB, nBLOBLen, &sHeader) == OGRERR_NONE &&
    7666        1353 :             static_cast<size_t>(nBLOBLen) >= sHeader.nHeaderLen + 5)
    7667             :         {
    7668        1353 :             err = OGRReadWKBGeometryType(pabyBLOB + sHeader.nHeaderLen,
    7669             :                                          wkbVariantIso, &eGeometryType);
    7670        1353 :             if (eGeometryType == wkbGeometryCollection25D &&
    7671           4 :                 (poContext->m_nFlags & OGR_GGT_GEOMCOLLECTIONZ_TINZ) != 0)
    7672             :             {
    7673             :                 auto poGeom = std::unique_ptr<OGRGeometry>(
    7674           2 :                     GPkgGeometryToOGR(pabyBLOB, nBLOBLen, nullptr));
    7675           1 :                 if (poGeom)
    7676             :                 {
    7677           1 :                     const auto poGC = poGeom->toGeometryCollection();
    7678           1 :                     if (poGC->getNumGeometries() > 0)
    7679             :                     {
    7680             :                         auto eSubGeomType =
    7681           1 :                             poGC->getGeometryRef(0)->getGeometryType();
    7682           1 :                         if (eSubGeomType == wkbTINZ)
    7683           1 :                             eGeometryType = wkbTINZ;

    9094          26 : static void OGR_GPKG_GeometryExtent3DAggregate_Step(sqlite3_context *pContext,
    9095             :                                                     int /*argc*/,
    9096             :                                                     sqlite3_value **argv)
    9097             : {

    9099          26 :         reinterpret_cast<const GByte *>(sqlite3_value_blob(argv[0]));
    9100             : 
    9101             :     auto poContext = static_cast<GeometryExtent3DAggregateContext *>(
    9102          26 :         sqlite3_user_data(pContext));
    9103             : 
    9104          26 :     if (pabyBLOB != nullptr)
    9105             :     {
    9106             :         GPkgHeader sHeader;
    9107          26 :         if (OGRGeoPackageGetHeader(pContext, 0, argv, &sHeader, true, true))
    9108             :         {
    9109          26 :             OGREnvelope3D extent3D;
    9110          26 :             extent3D.MinX = sHeader.MinX;
    9111          26 :             extent3D.MaxX = sHeader.MaxX;
    9112          26 :             extent3D.MinY = sHeader.MinY;
    9113          26 :             extent3D.MaxY = sHeader.MaxY;
    9114          26 :             extent3D.MinZ = sHeader.MinZ;
    9115          26 :             extent3D.MaxZ = sHeader.MaxZ;
    9116          26 :             poContext->m_oExtent3D.Merge(extent3D);
    9117             :         }
    9118           0 :         else if (!sHeader.bEmpty)
    9119             :         {
    9120             :             // Try also spatialite geometry blobs
    9121           0 :             const int nBLOBLen = sqlite3_value_bytes(argv[0]);
    9122           0 :             OGRGeometry *poGeom = nullptr;
    9123           0 :             if (OGRSQLiteImportSpatiaLiteGeometry(pabyBLOB, nBLOBLen,
    9124           0 :                                                   &poGeom) == OGRERR_NONE &&
    9125           0 :                 poGeom && !poGeom->IsEmpty())
    9126             :             {

    9216             : 
    9217             : /************************************************************************/
    9218             : /*                              Truncate()                              */
    9219             : /************************************************************************/
    9220             : 
    9221             : /** Implements "DELETE FROM {table_name}" in an optimized way.
    9222             :  *
    9223             :  * Disable triggers if we detect that the only triggers on the table are ones
    9224             :  * under our control (i.e. the ones for the gpkg_ogr_contents table and the
    9225             :  * ones updating the RTree)
    9226             :  * And even if we cannot disable triggers, truncate the RTree before the main
    9227             :  * table, as this dramatically speeds up truncating the main table.
    9228             :  */
    9229           8 : OGRErr OGRGeoPackageTableLayer::Truncate()
    9230             : {
    9231           8 :     if (!m_poDS->GetUpdate())
    9232             :     {
    9233           2 :         CPLError(CE_Failure, CPLE_NotSupported, UNSUPPORTED_OP_READ_ONLY,
    9234             :                  "Truncate");
    9235           2 :         return OGRERR_FAILURE;
    9236             :     }
    9237             : 
    9238           6 :     ResetReading();
    9239           6 :     SyncToDisk();
    9240             : 
    9241           6 :     bool bOK = (m_poDS->SoftStartTransaction() == OGRERR_NONE);
    9242             : 
    9243             :     struct ReenableTriggers
    9244             :     {
    9245             :         sqlite3 *m_hDB = nullptr;
    9246             : 
    9247           4 :         explicit ReenableTriggers(sqlite3 *hDB) : m_hDB(hDB)
    9248             :         {
    9249           4 :         }
    9250             : 
    9251           4 :         ~ReenableTriggers()

    9254             :                               nullptr);
    9255           4 :         }
